item.title: Drow
item.description:
Col A race of Elves who live on Xen'drik

Like all other elves, drow were former slaves of the Giants, but remained in Xen'drik after the Giants civilization collapsed. The three main cultural groups of drow are the Vulkoori, the Sulatar, and the Umbragen.
Drow are generally dark-skinned, and smaller and thinner than other elves. Drow can often have vivid red eyes. Their hair color can vary from white to other pale shades, such as grey, silver, or white-gold. Female drow are slightly larger than male drow.Varies between tribes.

item.title: Elf
item.description:
Col A race of graceful humaniods known for their long lifespans.
Elves of Eberron are descended from the Eladrin of the feyspire city of Shae Tirias Tolai.
During the Age of Giants, the city was ransacked by the giants of Xen'drik and its inhabitants were enslaved. This enslavement changed the Eladrin into the elves we know today, and allowed them to learn magic from the giants. After the fall of this civilization, many elves fled to the continent Aerenal.
During the Age of Monsters, some of the elves of Aerenal departed to Khorvaire and settled in modern day Valenar. This colony was later abandoned, but during The Last War, elves mercenaries of the Valaes Tairn cited this as justification for founding the nation of Valenar.Elves can vary in skin, hair, and eye color. They are usually taller, 5'6"- 6'5" ft tall, but only 150-190lbs. They have long, pointed ears and usually long, elegant features.
Elves in Eberron are known to be strange and diverse people. The elves who live in Khorvaire have integrated into society, and now have similar culture and identity.
High King Shaeras Vadallia: War leader of the Valaes Tairn and the head of state of Valenar.
Balaereth and Tezaera Mendyrian: Current Sibling Kings of Aerenal
Baron Elvinor Elorrenthi d'Phiarlan: Current Matriarch of House Phiarlan.
Baron Elar d'Thuranni: Current Patriarch of House Thuranni.
Maza ir'Thadian: Only current elven member of the Sharn city council.
Syraen Melideth: Governor of Pylas Talaear.
Mordain the Fleshweaver: Former wizard of The Twelve and member of House Phiarlan.

item.title: Elf
Dragonmarks
item.description:
Caption
An example of an Aberrant Mark
Physical manifestations of the Draconic Prophecy that appear as unique, natural marks on certain bloodlines.
Dragonmarks are physical manifestations of the Draconic Prophecy, and typically appear on certain bloodlines of Khorvaire. They can appear at random, sometimes creating an Aberrant Dragonmark. Dragonmarks are physical marks, more intricate than a birthmark and more distinct than a tattoo. As the wearer ages, and the dragonmark gains power, it will start to expand in size and complexity while keeping the same general shape and idea. Dragonmarks vary in patterns and color, depending on the house and the wearer.There are four different types of marks. Lesser, Greater, Siberys, and Aberrant.
Lesser marks are typically the first marks to appear when a creature reaches adolescence. These are the simplest forms of the mark, and offer the lowest form of magic. These can be studied and focused on to create Greater Marks.

Greater marks are often results of an expanding and growing lesser mark. These marks offer a greater power, with less understanding. Most average mark wearers will reach their full potential with a greater mark.

Siberys marks are the rarest mark, and the final form of a dragonmark. Most mark wearers never reach the Siberys evolution, and those who do are said to be descendants of Siberys himself.
Aberrant dragonmarks can appear on any race, and are the most dangerous mark form. The most common way to manifest an aberrant mark is for two different dragonmarked families to have a child. This union is forbidden by The Twelve.
Before the formation of Galifar, aberrant marks were much more common. The first Sharn was destroyed with an earthquake by the powers of an aberrant leader. In an effort to eradicate dangerous individuals, the dragonmarked houses united in the War of the Mark and hunted down all aberrant marks, significantly reducing the numbers of those which such marks. Present day, aberrants are no longer hunted down and killed, but most dragonmarks fear the aberrants, and will not hesitate to take them out.
Associated with the House Medani The mark of detection provides the wearer with the ability to detect traps and possible dangers.
Lesser Properties: When you make an Investigation or Insight check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Detect Magic spell prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. Greater Properties: You always have the Detect Poison and Disease spell prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3, you have access to See Invisibility and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on Investigation and Insight checks. Siberys Mark Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with the House Tharashk The mark of Finding grants the wearer abilities related to locating people and objects.
Lesser Properties: When you make a Perception or Survival check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Hunters Mark spell prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. Greater Properties: You have Date Object always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have access to Locate Object, and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on Perception and Survival checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with the House Vadalis The mark of Handling grants those who bear it the ability to calm, care for, and even control various animals.
Lesser Properties: When you make a Nature or Animal Handling check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Animal Friendship spell prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. Greater Properties: You have Speak With Animals always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you can target a Monstrosity when you cast the above spells if the creatures intelligence score is 5 or lower. You have advantage on Nature and Animal Handling checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House Jorasco The Mark of Healing grants wearers with magic that cure and aid those in need.
Lesser Properties: When you make a Medicine or Herbalism Kit check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Cure Wounds spell prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. Greater Properties: You have Aid always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have access to Lesser Restoration, and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on Medicine and Herbalism Kit checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House Ghallanda The Mark of Hospitality provides those who bear it the gift to provide food and shelter.
Lesser Properties: When you make a Charisma, Brewer's Supplies or Cook's Utensils check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Purify Food and Drink spell prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. Greater Properties: You have Unseen Servant always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have access to Calm Emotions, and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on Charisma, Brewer's Supplies or Cook's Utensils checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House Cannith The Mark of Making bestows the wearer a number of abilities designed to mend and create inanimate objects.
Lesser Properties: When you make an Arcana or Artisan Tools check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Mending cantrip available. Greater Properties: You have Magic Weapon always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have access to Homunculus Servant, and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on Arcana or Artisan Tools checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House Orien The Mark of Passage grants the bearer magic relating to transportation, and even teleportation.
Lesser Properties: When you make an Athletics or Acrobatics check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. Your Speed increases by 5 feet. Greater Properties: You have Misty Step always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. Your Speed increases by 5. You have advantage on Athletics and Acrobatics checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day. In addition, you gain an 5 feet of movement.: Infobox
Associated with House Sivis The Mark of Scribing bestows powers related to written word and communication.
Lesser Properties: When you make a History or Calligraphers Tools check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Message cantrip available. Greater Properties: You have Comprehend Languages always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have access to Magic Mouth, and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on History or Calligraphers Tools checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House of Deneith The Mark of Sentinel bestows powers to keep others from coming to harm.
Lesser Properties: When you make an Insight or Perception check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You know the Sentinel feat. Greater Properties: You have Shield always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3, when a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can take a reaction to swap places with that creature, and take the attack damage yourself. You have advantage on Insight or Perception checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House Lyrandar The Mark of Storm bestows powers over the weather.
Lesser Properties: When you make an Acrobatics or Navigator's Tools check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Thunderclap cantrip available. Greater Properties: You have Gust of Wind always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have Resistance to Lightning and Thunder Damage. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House Kundarak The Mark of Storm bestows powers over the weather.
Lesser Properties: When you make an Investigation or Thieves Tools check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You have Alarm always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. Greater Properties: You have Mage Armor always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have access to Arcane Lock, and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on Investigation and Theives Tools checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with House Phiarlan and House Thuranni The Mark of Storm bestows illusory and divinitive powers to the bearer.
Lesser Properties: When you make a Performance or Stealth check, you can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. You always have the Minor Illusion cantrip available. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. Greater Properties: You have Blur always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 you have access to Invisibility, and can cast it in the same way. You have advantage on Performance and Stealth checks. Siberys Properties: You have learned how to use your mark as a spellcasting focus. You now have access to the following spells, and can cast each once per day: Infobox
Associated with Vol Elves The Mark of Death has unknown powers, as it is believed to be extinct.
The Mark of Death appeared on elves on the island of Aerenal around 3200 years ago. This mark appeared most dominantly on the House Phiarlan bloodlines, but only in the Vol Elves. Those marked by Death were eradicated completely by the Undying Court and the Dragons of Argonnessen.Bourne by any race An Aberrant Mark is the most destructive and unpredictable mark. Lesser Properties: When you make a constitution saving throw, you can add 1d4 to the roll. You can use this once per long rest, or more in exchange for a point of exhaustion. You've learned to utilize your mark, you learn 1 cantrip from the sorcerer spell list. Greater Properties: You have a level 1 spell from the sorcerer list always prepared, and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. You can also use an appropriate spell slot to cast this spell. At level 3 when you cast this spell, you can expend one of your hit die and roll it. If you roll an even number, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the number rolled. If you roll an odd number, one creature within 30 ft of you will take force damage equal to the number rolled. If no other creatures are in range, you take the damage. Siberys Properties: Instead of a 1d4, you can now add 1d6 to a constitution saving throw once per day, or in exchange for a point of exhaustion. Increase your constitution score by 1, to a max of 20. Other abilities may be available depending on the mark.

item.title: Siberys
item.description:
Siberys was one of the Progenitor Dragons, who was unfortunately slain by his sister, Khyber. Scattered across the dark void, his scales became the glittering stars seen now across the sky of Eberron. At night, you can see a ring of golden stars surrounding the world, called The Ring of Siberys.
After the slaughter of Siberys and the binding of Khyber, the blood of Siberys, the body of Eberron became alive, and created the first Dragons. Some of this blood did not rain upon the world, and thus granted life to his own creatures, the Coatls.
As his life force faded from the fabric of the cosmosis, Siberys became the force of magic which permeates everything. It is said that he is the reason why magic is available to all races, especially Dragons.

item.title: Khyber
item.description:
Khyber, one of the Progenitor Dragons, killed her brother Siberys, which then caused her sister Eberron, to entrap her and create the world of Eberron.
Khyber has one sister, who also happens to be her keeper, Eberron. She also has a brother who she murdered herself named Siberys.

item.title: Eberron
item.description:
The World of Eberron
The world of Eberron is composed of 7 different continents. Khorvaire is the most diverse continent, and had hosted The Last War. Aerenal is an island continent that lies to the southeast of Khorvaire. Xen'drik is south of Khorvaire, and is home to ancient magic. Sarlona lies west, the original home of humans. Argonnessen is known for its dragons and barbarian human tribes. Frostfell is a landmass located north of Khorvaire, and is a region of ice and snow. The last, Everice, is a shifting sheet of ice located south of Xen'drik. The subterranean continent is known as Khyber.

Eberron was the name of one of the founding dragons of Eberron, or also known as a member of the Progenitor Dragons. Eberron created the world with a noble sacrifice, and was hence then named after her.
Eberron was one of three siblings. She had one sister, Khyber, and one brother, Siberys.

item.title: Draconic Prophecy
item.description:
For days, she had watched the signs appear in the heavens, cross-referencing the omens with the Codex of Alaraxus and the movement of smoke and water. This was the final piece in the puzzle. The Lord of Fire would rise again in the City of Illusions, and only three could return him to his prison: the child of storms, the shaper of steel, and the hand of the Keeper. Tonight she would head to Khorvaire; tomorrow she would begin the search for her soldiers of destiny.
There is no defined origin or creator of the Draconic Prophecy, but many speculate it was created by the Progenitor Dragons. This ancient force transcends history, shaping the destiny of Eberron.
The Draconic Prophecy reveals itself in various different ways around the world. From the stars to the moon, clouds, mountain ridges, trees, rivers, and especially Dragonmarks borne by certain humanoids.
The blue dragon Ourelonastrix and the coatl Hezcalipa first discovered the prophecys potential and used its knowledge to lead the Dragons and Coatls in their war against the Overlords. However, this did not pan out how they had hoped.
The Draconic Prophecy is very difficult to transcribe and read, typically. The Dragons of Argonnessen observe and record every sign of the draconic prophecy. This includes the positions of the moon, stars, the position of The Ring of Siberys, and physical manifestations of Dragonmarks. Creatures with the longest lifespans, such as Dragons, Aerenal elves, and other immortal beings have the ability and patience to truly understand the prophecy.
The followers of Thir believe the prophecy is a recollection of creation itself. To them, they are to observe the natural happenings of the prophecy as it writes its own destiny in real time.
The Chamber believes that the prophecy can be used to shape the future. They believe it is a tool or a guide, and the Dragons play a key role.
The Lords of Dust: seek to use the prophecy to free their ancient masters. They are experts in twisting the prophecy to their advantage, purposely setting events into motion that might one day lead to the return of the Overlords.

item.title: Aasimar
item.description:
Col Aasimars are the descendants of humans and celestial bloodlines. This race is very rare on the world of Eberron. They often live amongst other races, and have a wide array of looks based off of their celestial parent.

Aasimars are children of a Human and celestial bloodline. Their ancestors can be one of a multitude of races from one of many planes.
Homeland: Aasimar can be found on both Khorvaire and Sarlona.Aasimar are often tall, attractive, and usually have subtle celestial traits such as golden eyes or silver hair. Of course the celestial traits often depend on the celestial ancestry.
Generally good aligned. Much like Paladins, Aasimar fight in favor of their celestial ancestor. They tend to live in isolation, however some have been known to integrate into society.
Prince Lorrister of the Heavenly Fleet

item.title: Angel
item.description:
Col Angels are a race of celestial that fight on the side of good. They exist on various planes. When angels become corrupted, they are cast out by their brethren, ripped of their wings and damned to the Material Plane. These angels become radiant idols who serve the cause of evil. They often seek revenge on their brethren.

Angels have been known to hail from multiple planar regions, such as Irian, Shavarath, and Syrania. They serve the cause of Sovereign Host, however they do not have direct access to the words of their lords. Some angels serve the Church of the Silver Flame, and can be found in Flamekeep.Angels are the peak of flawless beauty. Most angels stand taller than mortals at 9'. They possess a variety of skin and hair colors. They have feathery wings that sprout from their shoulders. Angels may appear differently depending on their homeland. Deva: Divine Messengers Planetars: Divine Warriors Solars: Most powerful angels with godlike abilities. Angels are paragons of virtue, honor, and honesty. They are trustworthy diplomats. Angels do not wish violence, but will engage quickly if the need arises.
'Vyrael, The Guardian of the portal between Syrania and Sharn.

item.title: Archon
item.description:
Col Archons are celestial beings who fight the endless battle for good against demons and devils.
Archons, similar to angels, are planar forces of good. The main difference being that archons are not afraid to do what they have to in the name of good. Archons strive to end the demonic control that consumes Shavarath.
During The Last War, in the year 983 YK, Thrane summoned four archons to spearhead their Great Eastern Campaign. These archons, named the Messengers, each led a separate division:
the Army of the Ascended
the Righteous Legion
the Legion of True Brethren
The Army of the Eastern Crusade
Each archon commanded roughly 10,000 troops. The archons led Thrane to take the cities of Eston and Kalazart. However, upon obtaining large trunks of books and scrolls, the forces withdrew to Flamekeep, and the Messengers vanished. Varies between species:
Hound Archon
Lantern Archon
Archons are very similar to angels. They tend to forego honor and virtue in the name of good.
Prince Lorrister of the Heavenly Fleet

item.title: Azer
item.description:
Col Azer are fiery, Dwarf-like creatures native to the plane of Fernia.

Azers are primarily weaponsmiths, working with primal elements to create unique weapons. They can primarily be found on Fernia, but can also be spotted on the volcanic fields of Xen'drik.Azers very closely resemble dwarves, but with flames instead of hair/beards. They have brass colored skin that almost appears forged. They tend to dress in brass, copper, or bronze.Azer are a generally reserved species, very dedicated to their work. However they will fight if provoked. They love gemstones, and will fight to the death if enraged in combat.

item.title: Bugbear
item.description:
Col A massive humanoid distantly related to goblins and hobgoblins. They are one of the only goblinoids to be covered in fur. Like many goblinoids, bugbears were once part of the dominant civilization of Khorvaire thousands of years ago.

Bugbear are believes to have originated during the rise of the Dhakaani Empire, bred by the hobgoblins to serve as slaves and elite soldiers. After the dissolution of the Dhakaani Empire, bugbear continued to be ruled by the hobgoblins in tribes known as the Ghaal'dar. Some bugbear rebelled, seizing the land by the Seawall Mountains anf forming their own tribes. These tribes became known as the "Marguul", or warrior kings.
Now, some of the Marguul pay homage to Lhesh Haruuc, while others continue to fight Haruuc's forces, vowing to never bow to a Hobgoblin again.
Otherwise, bugbear can be found in small numbers across Khorvaire, and often live peacefully.Bugbear resemble hairy, beastly goblins standing at 7 ft. tall. Their noses and claws share a resemblance to bears, hence the name. They typically weigh in between 200-450 lbs.Bugbear tend to have a truthful reputation of being dim-witted and brutish. In their societies, they tend to value violence among themselves.

item.title: Bullywug
item.description:
Col Bullywugs, a race of froglike humaniods present on the east coast of Khorvaire

Bullywug are native to the eastern coast of Khorvaire, particularly the warmer regions, such as the Lhazaar Principalities. Their ancestors were supposedly once humans or goblinoids transformed by a god called the Lord of the Murky Waters. They are known for their ancient conflict with the Lizardfolk.Bullywug are amphibious humanoids that stand between 5'4"-6' and weigh 150 to 240 lbs.
Bullywug can often be seen as cruel and aggressive, especially in the Trub Glorp tribe, which brought them to conflict with humans. These creatures tend to ruin any land they come across, even their own swamps. However, they do not appear to be unaware of this phenomenon. The difference in environment can create a sense of self-doubt and paranoia, thinking everything is out to get them. Some bullywug have been documented to resorting to cannibalism, however some cannibalize by choice.

item.title: Half-Elf (Khoravar)
item.description:
Col As they originate from Khorvaire, half evles call themselves Khoravar.

Khoravar are a race created by the interbreeding of elves and humans. Two khoravar houses are known to have dragonmark bloodlines: House Lyrandar and House Medani.
Khoravar can have any color skin, hair, eyes, or other attributes. They often have half elven ears, and share other features common between humans and elves. They average 5'5"-6'2", and 130-190lbs.Like their ancestors, Khoravar can have any type of personality, alignment, or goals.

item.title: Progenitor Dragons
item.description:
And thus rose the dawn of EberronThe Progenitor Dragons consist of three siblings: Khyber, Eberron, and Siberys.
For some malevolent reason, Khyber murdered her brother Siberys. To contain the evil, Eberron used her own body as a prison to contain Khyber. The blood of Siberys spilt over Eberron, creating the first life, Dragons. Siberys' blood was also used to independantly create Coatls. His scales created the cosmos, and whats now known as The Ring of Siberys.

Human
item.description:
Col The most populous race on Khorvaire, but not native to the area.

Humans are a relatively young race, originating from the island of Sarlona. The first humans to settle on Khorvaire were a settlement lead by Lhazaar roughly 3,000 years ago. Humans quickly spread across Khorvaire, often clashing with the native goblinoids. They soon began to create their own settlements and kingdoms, creating independent cultures than that of Sarlona. Several major families started developing, even earning and developing their own dragonmarks.
Roughly 1,000 years later, the first human nation of Karrnath rose under the leadership of Karrn the Conquerer. Quickly, Karrn conquered and claimed modern day Cyre. Swiftly after, three other human led nations banded together to end this conquisition.
A second wave of humans travelling from Sarlona arrived not long after in the Shadow Marches and Demon Wastes. Those who survived now reside in The Shadow Marches.Current day humans do not have much regard for their ancestral continent, or even know that is where they hail from.Humans can bear any color skin, hair, eyes, and average 5-6ft tall and 125-250 lbs.Humans have a range of personality based off of their home, job, and society. Typically they are seen as ambitious, innovative, and diverse.
Lhazaar: Leader of the first human settlers on Khorvaire
Karrn the Conquerer: Conquerer of modern day [[Cyre]
King Jarot: Deceased king of Galifar, catalyst for The Last War

item.title: Changeling
item.description:
Col I will protect your children if they follow my path. Let them wander the world. They may be shunned and feared, but they will never be destroyed. Jes agreed, and the traveler gave her his cloak. When she draped it over her children, their old faces melted away and they could be whoever they wanted to be. And so it remains. Though the children are shunned by all, the gift of the Traveler protects them still.
About 1300 years ago in early Khorvaire, the leaders of the precursor nations of Cyre, Karrnath, and Thrane launched a genocidal attack against changelings within their borders. This forced many to flee to the precursor lands of Aundair and Breland to live in secrecy.
Long after, a changeling known as Kel become unhappy with the constant hiding the changelings were forced into. He missioned across Khorvaire to find other changeling covens, and began a gradual migration to the Lhazaar Principalities before settling on Lastpoint.
There is speculation that changelings resulted from the interbreeding of humans and doppelgangers. As the offspring evolved, they formed into their own distinct race.
Another popular theory is that changelings originated first, and doppelgangers were modeled after their talents.
Another belief states that the first changeling, tiefling, and skulk bloodlines began amongst the sages of the kingdom of Ohr Kaluun, by making body altering pacts will fell beings.
Some changeling priests tell a faithful story about a woman named Jes, with 100 children. In times of trouble, she sought an audience with the Sovereign Host, but was met with silence. Eventually, a lone traveler came and promised to protect Jes' children, only if they followed the travelers path. Accepting Jes, she was given a cloak that she spread over her hundred children. Though their former faces melted away, they had the ability to look like whoever they wanted, becoming the changeling race.
Others speculate that this traveler channeled his will and desires into doppelgangers to create a new race for an unknown purpose.
Finally, some believe changelings to be a magical manifestation starting in the Feywild.
In their natural form, they look human, but appear faded or lacking detail, like an unfinished painting. They appear to have a gray, gauzy extra layer of skin over their bodies. Their skin tone is pale, typically white or light grey, and their hair is thin and fair, commonly silver-white, platinum blond, with some traces of green, pink, or blue. They have blank, colorless eyes that appear sunken. Their other features are barely noticeable, and typically expressionless. They typically stand at 5-6ft, and are usually frail and gangly bodied. Most changelings adopt a few personas to serve them in different times of need. They can be of any moral stance, but many face pragmatic neutrality, worrying about their own needs and issues. They are largely uninterested in social interactions. They believe that life is short, and they should make the most of it. A changeling will not "make do", they will maximize their current experience, and try to live a most leisurely life. These creatures excel at learning new languages, and have an appreciation for magic and technology similar to their powers.
